Description: Two joining sherds of rim of of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat pottery lid; underside reserved; on upper surafces cream slip; on edge of rim sets of opposed diagonal lines with glaze triangular fill; on top of rim red line; short verticals on flat moulding at edge of lid proper, with clear change of brush; part of animal frieze preserved on lid proper: beard and front legs of goat grazing to left, rosette between legs.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1081)
